Text: I was flight officer on an old tin can from before the war. We were on a surveying flight, off McMurdo.
Our route was towards the western end of the Getz ice shelf, to photograph unmapped areas inland.
As we passed the Flood Range, our navigator thought he saw something in the crevasses below. A fire-like glow. Our plane shut down immediately.
We nearly died trying to glide the plane down safely against the winds. But our problems didn't end there, and we soon had unexpected visitors.
